edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository
Class RepositoryPeer

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository.RepositoryPeer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Peer
public class RepositoryPeer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Peer

RepositoryPeer represents each peer, either the local one or a remote one.

Author:
Jie Ren

fileAdded

public boolean fileAdded(java.lang.String fileName,
                         double radius,
                         double angle)
The peer has added a file

Specified by:
fileAdded in interface Peer
Parameters:
fileName - the name of the newly added file
radius - the relative radius (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file. This might be null if another application creates the file
angle - the relative angle (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file. This might be null if another application creates the file
Returns:
true if there was not such a file, false otherwise

Returns:

owns

public boolean owns(java.lang.String fileName)
Whether the peer owns a file

Specified by:
owns in interface Peer
Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file
Returns:
true if the peer owns it and has not suspended the ownership of it, false if it does not own it or it has temporarily suspended the ownership

Whether the local peer imports the file into the private space

Returns:

service

public java.lang.Object service(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                boolean forward,
                                boolean identifySelf)
Execute a request towards this (remote) peer. It is invoked by the filter to direct the request to an owner peer. This method executes a HttpClient call and forward the response back to the original client. This extra round trip affects performance.

Parameters:
request - the original request
response - the original response
forward - if true, then the response from the method will be forwarded to the original response.
identifySelf - whether the method should add a header to identify itself
Returns:
the response body of the execution, can be either a string or a XML document
